com.metaio.sdk.jni
Class IAnnotatedGeometriesGroup

java.lang.Object
  com.metaio.sdk.jni.IAnnotatedGeometriesGroup

public class IAnnotatedGeometriesGroup
extends Object

Replacement for IBillboardGroup which places geometries at their real location. Additionally manages their selection via focusing the most central geometries in the camera image. Furthermore, annotations are managed for each geometry.Note the difference between the terms "geometry" and "annotation" throughout the method names. "Geometries" are the geometries placed in 3D space (e.g. at a POI's LLA coordinates), while annotations' positions are determined by the implementation and aligned in 2D screen space.

removeGeometry

public void removeGeometry(IGeometry geometry)
Caller is responsible for destroying both the geometry and its annotation (which is not used anymore by this class after this call) after calling this method!

Parameters:
geometry - Geometry to remove

setBottomPadding

public void setBottomPadding(long value)
This is helpful if you want to add user interface elements to the bottom of the viewport.

Parameters:
value - Absolute padding in pixels

setSelectedGeometry

public void setSelectedGeometry(IGeometry geometry)
There can only be one selected geometry - or none.This call will immediately trigger IAnnotatedGeometriesGroupCallback::onFocusStateChanged. If there was a selected geometry, its state changes from EGFS_SELECTED to either EGFS_FOCUSED or EGFS_UNFOCUSED. The newly assigned selected geometry (if any) will change its state to EGFS_SELECTED.If the geometry is already selected, this method does nothing at all (no callback triggered).

Parameters:
geometry - Geometry that should be the selected one, or NULL to deselect any existing selection. This must be the same geometry pointer as passed into addGeometry (not the annotation instance!).

triggerAnnotationUpdate

public void triggerAnnotationUpdate(IGeometry geometry)
if location changed and annotation text or information needs to be changed)May be implemented asychronously, i.e. the annotation update callback will only be called from the next update() call instead of immediately. (But: Method is not thread-safe.)

Parameters:
geometry - Geometry whose associated annotation should be updated
